intro: Calathea lagunae, commonly known as the Lake Calathea, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the Marantaceae family and is characterized by its striking, variegated foliage. The leaves are typically broad and heart-shaped, with intricate patterns of silver, green, and pink. It thrives in humid environments with bright, indirect light. Calathea lagunae requires well-draining soil and consistent moisture to flourish.
